text: Dick Clark (November 30, 1929 â€” April 18, 2012) was an American television entertainer. He was nicknamed "the world's oldest teenager". From the 1950s to the 2000s, he entertained people from around the United States, as well as the rest of the world. He became famous due to his show American Bandstand. He also hosted game shows, including The $100,000 Pyramid. His other shows included Dick Clark's New Year's Rockin' Eve with Ryan Seacrest. Clark died on the morning of April 18, 2012 in Santa Monica, California from a heart attack. == References == == Other websites == * * * Category:Emmy Award winning actors Category:American movie actors Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American voice actors Category:American radio actors Category:American radio personalities Category:Television personalities from New York (state) Category:American television presenters Category:Deaths from myocardial infarction Category:American game show hosts Category:Businesspeople from New York (state) Category:Actors from New York (state) Category:1929 births Category:2012 deaths Category:National Radio Hall of Fame inductees Category:People from Mount Vernon, New York
title: Dick Clark
